means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 贾斯蒂斯绰号，公正的人也可能是职业名称，法官来源于拉丁语，含义是“正义，法律”(right,law)
[地名] [加拿大、美国] 贾斯蒂斯

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"诚实，正直"之意。
means: integrity ： 指品格纯正，有高度是非感，正直诚实，受人敬佩。
honesty ： 普通用词，侧重为人忠厚，老实，正直，不欺骗，不说谎。
justice ： 侧重办事或处事公正、公道不偏心。

sentence.Network_en: I too am committing myself to continue the fight for justice.
sentence.Network_cn: 我本人也保证将继续为正义而战。

sentence.Network_en: He was charged with conspiring to pervert the course of justice.
sentence.Network_cn: 他被控谋划妨碍司法公正。

sentence.Network_en: This courtroom battle has been a poor advert for English justice.
sentence.Network_cn: 这场法庭上的争论为英格兰的司法制度做了一次拙劣的广告。

PerfectNetExp.abs: ...工学院(MIT)的一些最好的教授的课程，包括哈佛大学教授迈克尔·桑德尔主讲的、受哈佛学生多年追捧的“公正(justice)“，也成为网络开放式课程之一，而我搜索了一下我们中国高校的相关网络开放式课程，发现寥寥无几，你怎么看.
塔罗牌_互动百科 ... 【8】力量（ Strength，VIII） 【11】正义（justice）（ Justice，XI） 6、恋人 the Lovers.
有个J开头的单词_百度知道 ... just ad. 刚才；只是；正好 justice n. 正义，公正；司法 justify vt. 证明…是正当的.
公平（justice）的词源跟有些词汇的词源都很有趣。它经常反复出现在人类历史上的重要的著作中。

Brandon Wong 黄炯耀 - xinmsn -... ... 我们等你 Don’t Stop Believin' 微笑正义 Poetic Justice 好运到 It’s A Wonderful Life.
印地安那大学伯明顿分校_百度百科 ... 心理学 Psychology 刑事司法（criminal justice） Criminal Justice/Safety 历史学 History.
...不管这些哩，我比较好奇的是，有一些蛋头学者所提出的转型正义（Transitional Justice）这个词汇。

jx.jx_en_mean: arrest someone for a crime and ensure that they are tried in court
jx.jx_cn_mean: 拘捕审判（某人)，依法惩处（某人)，绳之以法

jx.jx_en_mean: perform as well as one is able to
jx.jx_cn_mean: 竭尽全力，充分发挥自己的能力

jx.jx_en_mean: do, treat, or represent with due fairness or appreciation
jx.jx_cn_mean: 公平处理；公平对待；充分表现，充分展示

lj.lj_ly: the brief menu does not &B{do justice to} the food.
lj.lj_ls: 这份简短的菜单没有充分说明食物的特色。

jx.jx_cn_mean: 对…作出应有的评价，公正地对待，为对…公平起见

lj.lj_ly: I say this in justice to both of you.
lj.lj_ls: 为了对你们两人公平起见，我说了这些话。

jx.jx_en_mean: (Brit.)a form of address or reference to a judge of the supreme court (e.g. a High Court judge)
jx.jx_cn_mean: (英)［用于称呼或指代最高法院的法官（如高级法院法 官）］

jx.jx_en_mean: To treat adequately, fairly, or with full appreciation
jx.jx_cn_mean: 适当地、公平地对待，充分地评判

lj.lj_ly: The subject is so complex that I cannot do justice to it in a brief survey.
lj.lj_ls: 这个主题太复杂，我无法只通过简略的研究就对它做出公正的评价

means.word_mean: 正确,确实,合法,正当理由

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English iustise 'administration of the law', via Old French from Latin justitia, from justus (see just)

encyclopedia.content: 替身所有者：奈亚婆婆 荒木飞吕彦的漫画《JoJo奇妙冒险》第三部人物奈亚婆婆是替身使者。空条承太郎一行离开印度，到巴基斯坦的路上遇到的强大敌人。奈亚婆婆是倒吊男（杰·卡尔）的母亲，因为儿子被杀死了而要复仇，她杀掉了整个村子的人，并用自己的替身控制他们，引诱承太郎一行下榻旅馆，借机杀害他们。最后被承太郎打败，因为对迪奥（Dio）的忠心最终被肉芽杀死。 替身：正义JUSTICE奈亚婆婆是替身使者。替身形象：雾状替身

entry.def: Justice is fairness in the way that people are treated.

example.ex: He has a good overall sense of justice and fairness...
example.tran: 他极富正义感和公平意识。

example.ex: He only wants freedom, justice and equality...
example.tran: 他只要自由、公正和平等。

entry.tran: （理由、要求或论点的）合理，正当，正确，公道
entry.def: The justice of a cause, claim, or argument is its quality of being reasonable, fair, or right.

example.ex: We are a minority and must win people round to the justice of our cause.
example.tran: 我们属于少数群体，必须赢得人们对我们的正义事业的支持。

entry.def: Justice is the legal system that a country uses in order to deal with people who break the law.

example.ex: Many in Toronto's black community feel that the justice system does not treat them fairly...
example.tran: 多伦多的黑人群体中有很多人觉得司法制度对待他们有失公正。

example.ex: A lawyer is part of the machinery of justice.
example.tran: 律师是司法体系的一部分。

example.ex: Thomas will be sworn in today as a justice on the Supreme Court.
example.tran: 托马斯今天将宣誓就任最高法院法官。

entry.def: Justice is used before the names of judges.

example.ex: A preliminary hearing was due to start today before Mr Justice Hutchison, but was adjourned.
example.tran: 今天法官哈奇森先生本来要主持一项预审，但暂时休庭了。

entry.tran: 将…绳之以法；把…缉拿归案
entry.def: If a criminal is brought to justice, he or she is punished for a crime by being arrested and tried in a court of law.

example.ex: They demanded that those responsible be brought to justice...
example.tran: 他们要求将责任人缉拿归案。

example.ex: She'd need proof to bring Jason to justice.
example.tran: 她需要有证据才能将贾森绳之以法。

entry.tran: 准确地再现；逼真地重现
entry.def: To do justice to a person or thing means to reproduce them accurately and show how good they are.

example.ex: The photograph I had seen didn't  do her justice...
example.tran: 我看到的那张照片把她拍得走样了。

example.ex: Most TV sets don't have the sound quality to do justice to the music.
example.tran: 大多数电视机的音质不好，无法播出原来的音乐效果。

entry.tran: 妥善应付；恰当处理；尽力全面做好
entry.def: If you do justice to someone or something, you deal with them properly and completely.

example.ex: No one article can ever do justice to the topic of fraud...
example.tran: 没有哪一篇文章能把欺诈这一话题讲得恰到好处。

example.ex: It is impossible here to do justice to the complex history of the Legion.
example.tran: 在这里不可能完整地论述古罗马军团复杂的历史。

entry.tran: 充分发挥能力；尽最大的努力
entry.def: If you do yourself justice, you do something as well as you are capable of doing it.

example.ex: I don't think he could do himself justice playing for England...
example.tran: 我认为他为英格兰队效力时不可能充分发挥自己的水平。

example.ex: I don't think I can win, but I want to do myself justice.
example.tran: 我认为我不会获胜，但我会尽自己最大的努力。

entry.def: If you describe someone's treatment or punishment as rough justice, you mean that it is not given according to the law.

example.ex: Trial by television makes for very rough justice indeed.
example.tran: 电视庭审实际上会令审判不公。

entry.def: If you say that something is rough justice for someone, you mean that they have not been treated fairly.

example.ex: It would have been rough justice had he been deprived of this important third European win.
example.tran: 要是他被剥夺了这一意义重大的第三个欧洲冠军头衔，那对他简直是太不公平了。

means.word_mean: 1. the quality of being just or fair
2. the administration of law; the act of determining rights and assigning rewards or punishments;
3. a public official authorized to decide questions bought before a court of justice

auth_sentence.content: They take you away, but not for justice.
auth_sentence.res_content: They take you away, but not for justice.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They take you away, but not for justice.

auth_sentence.content: But Chief Justice Roberts didn't accept that assertion.
auth_sentence.res_content: But Chief Justice Roberts didn't accept that assertion.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But Chief Justice Roberts didn't accept that assertion.

auth_sentence.content: The Justice Department says such a rule is unnecessary.
auth_sentence.res_content: The Justice Department says such a rule is unnecessary.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The Justice Department says such a rule is unnecessary.

Sentence.sentence: Self-made billionaires in Beijing, tech innovators in Silicon Valley, pioneering justices in Ghana—in these and countless other areas, women are leaving their mark.

means.word_mean: 正义; 公正, 合理

sentences.en: He had justice on his side.

means.word_mean: 法律制裁; 司法; 审判

sentences.en: Justice was met out to him.
The Chief Justice gave his judgement the week before.
sentences.cn: 首席法官于前一周做出判决。

jushi.english: He had justice on his side.
Children expect justice from their parents.
jushi.chinese: 孩子们希望父母公正地对待他们。

jushi.english: It is not altogether without justice.
